Income Tax.question: Mr. R is a partner in the partnership firm name AB & co. and he has received a share of profit of Rs. 8,80,000 from the partnership firm, what will be the taxability of such profit in the hand of Mr. R?
options: Rs. 880,000 will be exempted from tax
Income Tax.explanation: Share of profit from a partnership firm is exempt under section 10(2A).

Income Tax.question: Mr. Ram is working in abhay ltd and receiving 15,000 as uniform allowance, 3,000 as conveyance allowance. His actual expenditure of uniform is 9,000 and conveyance expenditure is 1000, find taxable allowance.
Income Tax.explanation: Uniform allowance exemption = 9,000, Conveyance exemption = 1,000. Taxable = 18,000 - (9,000 + 1,000) = 8,000.

Income Tax.question: Mr. X who resides in Chennai get Rs. 300,000 P.A as basic salary. He received Rs. 50,000 P.A as house rent allowance. Rent paid by him for the rental accommodation occupied by him is Rs. 40,000. Find out the amount of taxable house rent allowance for Mr. X for the assessment year 2024-25.
Income Tax.explanation: Exemption = least of (HRA received 50,000; Rent paid - 10% salary = 40,000 - 30,000 = 10,000; 40% salary = 120,000). Exempt = 10,000. Taxable = 50,000 - 10,000 = 40,000. Wait correct? Let's check: Actually exemption = least of 50,000, 10,000, 120,000 → 10,000 exempt, taxable = 40,000. Correct answer = Rs. 40,000 taxable. (So option B).

Income Tax.question: X received Rs. 18,250 per month as a pension from the central government during the previous year 2023-24. What is the amount of pension taxable for the assessment year 2024-25, on the assumption that it becomes due on the last day of each month?
options: fully exempt from tax as he is government employee
Income Tax.explanation: Pension is fully taxable. Annual = 18,250 × 12 = 219,000.

Income Tax.question: The central government has been empowered by entry..................... of the union list of schedules VII of the constitution of India to levy tax on income other than agricultural income.
Income Tax.explanation: Entry 82 of Union List empowers levy of income tax other than agricultural income.

Income Tax.question: Income tax is...........in nature
Income Tax.explanation: Income tax follows progressive taxation – higher income, higher tax rate.

Income Tax.question: Standard deduction from the salaries is allowed to ........................
Income Tax.explanation: Standard deduction is available to all salaried employees.

Income Tax.question: What will be the amount of standard deduction if the gross salary of Mr. X is Rs. 52,000/-...........?
Income Tax.explanation: Standard deduction = ₹50,000 or salary, whichever is lower. Here salary = 52,000, so deduction = 50,000.

Income Tax.question: What is the maximum amount allowed as a standard deduction to an employee.......?
Income Tax.explanation: Maximum standard deduction = ₹50,000.

Income Tax.question: Deduction of entertainment allowance is available to the ..................
Income Tax.explanation: Entertainment allowance deduction is available only to government employees.

Income Tax.question: Calculate amount of deduction for entertainment allowance if actual entertainment allowance is ₹ 6,000 and basic salary is ₹ 40,000
Income Tax.explanation: Deduction is minimum of (₹5,000, 20% of salary = 8,000, actual allowance = 6,000). Hence, ₹4,000.

Income Tax.question: For the valuation of rent free furnished accommodation, if furniture is owned by the employer, the taxable value will be................
options: actual hire charges paid/payable by the employer
Income Tax.explanation: If furniture is owned by employer, perquisite = 10% of original cost of furniture.

Income Tax.question: Where the population size is more than 25 lakh, the value of purpose it will be ..........% of salary for the period during which the employee occupied the rent-free unfurnished accommodation.
Income Tax.explanation: If population exceeds 25 lakhs, valuation = 15% of salary.

Income Tax.question: X, an employee of the central government, received ₹78,000 as gratuity. He retires on December 12, 2021, after rendering service of 38 years and 8 month. At the time of retirement, his monthly basic salary and dearness allowance was ₹ 2,400 and ₹ 800 respectively. What is the exempt amount of gratuity?
Income Tax.explanation: For central/state government employees, gratuity is fully exempt. Hence ₹78,000.

Income Tax.question: Determine the residential status of Mr. X, a foreign citizen, resides in India during the previous year 2023-24 for 65 days further information of his stay in India during the last few previous years are as 2022-23: 03 days, 2021-22: 69 days, 2020-21: 220 days, 2019-20: 364 days, 2018-19: 75 days for the assessment year 2024-25.
options: Resident and not ordinary resident in India
Resident and ordinary resident in India
Income Tax.explanation: He does not satisfy basic condition of 182 days but satisfies 365 days in 4 years + 60 days in current year. Hence Resident. Additional conditions not met → Resident but not ordinarily resident.

Income Tax.question: Mr. Ramesh, an Indian citizen left India for first time for the purpose of getting employment outside India on 9-10-2022 for the first time. He came to India on 21-3-2023. Determine the residential status of Mr. Ramesh for the assessment year 2024-25.
options: Resident and not ordinary resident in India
Resident and ordinary resident in India
Income Tax.explanation: For employment abroad, stay of 182 days applies. He stayed less than 182 days in India → Non-resident.

Income Tax.question: A resident HUF is said to be not ordinarily resident in India
options: If Karta of HUF satisfies both additional conditions
If Karta of HUF satisfies both basic conditions
If HUF satisfies both additional conditions
If Karta of HUF satisfies only one additional condition
Income Tax.explanation: Resident HUF is not ordinarily resident if Karta satisfies both additional conditions (stay < 730 days in 7 preceding years or not resident in 9/10 years).

Income Tax.question: A foreign company is said to be resident in India only if the
options: Place of effective management in India
Place of effective management outside India
Income Tax.explanation: Foreign company is resident if Place of Effective Management (POEM) is in India.

Income Tax.question: Mr. Amit is resident but not ordinarily resident in India having interest income from deposit in USA of ₹ 300,000 (1/3 received in India) then how much amount is taxable in India?
Income Tax.explanation: For RNOR, income received in India is taxable. 1/3rd of 300,000 = 100,000 taxable.

Income Tax.question: Mr. Harsh is resident and ordinarily resident in India in P.Y.2023-24 and having remittance of profit from his business in Florida of ₹ 500,000 of past financial years then how much amount will be taxable?
Income Tax.explanation: Past untaxed profits remitted to India are not taxable. Hence nothing taxable.

Income Tax.question: Residential status of Mr. Karan for the P.Y.2023-24 is resident but not ordinarily resident in India. He has earned ₹ 480,000 from the business situated at USA being controlled from India. The whole income from the business is received by Mr. Karan in USA. What will be the taxable amount in the hands of Mr. Karan?
options: Whole amount will be not taxable
Income Tax.explanation: RNOR: Income from a business controlled from India is taxable in India even if received outside India. Hence entire ₹480,000 is taxable.

Income Tax.question: Which of the following statement are incorrect in respect of First previous year for the newly set up business or profession?
options: The period beginning from the date of setting up of the business and ending on the last day of that FY (31st March)
It will always start from 1st April and ends on 31st March
It can be less than 12 months.
It can never exceed a period of 12 months.
Income Tax.explanation: For newly set up business, the previous year starts from the date of setup, not 1st April. So statement (ii) is incorrect.

Income Tax.question: Which of the following are person as per u/s 2(31) of income tax act 1961?
Income Tax.explanation: Persons include Individuals, HUF, Company, Firm, AOP, BOI, LLP, Local authority, Artificial juridical person. So both B & C.

Income Tax.question: Which of the following income is taxable in the same year in which it is earned?
options: income of the person leaving India for a longer period
Income Tax.explanation: Capital gains are taxed in the same year they are earned (not deferred to next AY).

Income Tax.question: Any person who does not deduct tax at source or after deduction fails to pay deduction tax to the government is called as...........
Income Tax.explanation: Such a person is treated as 'Assessee in Default' under Income Tax Act.

Income Tax.question: Which of the following is not considered as an 'Income' under the provision of the income tax act, 1961?
Income Tax.explanation: Pin-money (small amounts given for personal expenses, like to a wife by husband) is not treated as income.

Income Tax.question: Mr. Amit has received scholarship of ₹ 90,000 during P.Y. 2023-24 to meet the cost of education. However, he spent only 50,000 towards education. Calculate the taxable amount of educational scholarship.
Income Tax.explanation: Scholarship for education is fully exempt under section 10(16), regardless of expenditure.

Income Tax.question: Mr. Alizeh received rent of ₹ 30,000 P.M during P.Y. 2023-24 from land which is situated in India and is used to agriculture purpose. Suggest the correct treatment with reference to income tax act, 1961
Income Tax.explanation: Agricultural income in India is fully exempt under section 10(1).

Income Tax.question: Which of the following income is partly taxable?
options: Payment received from family income by member of HUF
Share of profit from a partnership firm
Daily allowance of member of Parliament
Income Tax.explanation: Commuted pension is partly taxable depending on employee category (Govt or Non-govt).

Income Tax.question: A is minor son of Mr. P. A received interest on deposit Rs. ₹ 600 p.m. during P.Y 2023-24. Find out the amount of income that would be assessable to tax in the hands of Mr. X in respect of income of his minor child.
Income Tax.explanation: Minor’s income is clubbed with parent after exemption of ₹1,500. Annual interest = 7,200. Taxable = 7,200 - 1,500 = 5,700.

Income Tax.question: Mr. Y has two sons. He is in receipt of children education allowance of ₹ 150 p.m for his elder son and ₹ 170 p.m for his younger son. Both his sons are going to school. Compute his taxable Children education allowance.
Income Tax.explanation: Exemption allowed = ₹100 per month per child up to 2 children. Actual received = 3,840. Exempt = 2,400. Taxable = 1,440.

Income Tax.question: The Period of Previous year __________.
options: May be of More than 12 Months
Income Tax.explanation: In case of new business or source of income, previous year can be less than 12 months.

Income Tax.question: Income earned in __________ is Taxable in __________.
Income Tax.explanation: Income is earned in the previous year and taxed in the following assessment year.

Income Tax.question: Nachiket, who resides in Surat, gets ₹ 1,50,000 per annum as basic salary and commission @ 2% (on turnover ₹ 5,00,000). He receives ₹ 28,000 per annum as house rent allowance. Rent paid by him is ₹ 25,000 per annum. Find out the amount of exempt house rent allowance for the assessment year 2022-23.
Income Tax.explanation: Salary = 150,000 + 10,000 commission = 160,000. Exemption = least of (HRA 28,000; Rent - 10% salary = 25,000 - 16,000 = 9,000; 40% salary = 64,000). Hence exemption = 9,000. Taxable HRA = 19,000. Correct exempt = ₹9,000.

Income Tax.question: Mr. Y was in Indian army, died on august 30, 2021. From September 1, 2021 his Family started receiving family pension of ₹ 20,000 per month. Pension is Taxable under the head __________.
options: Under the head Income from Other Sources
Income Tax.explanation: Family pension is taxable under 'Income from Other Sources'.

Income Tax.question: When Company is not said as resident in India-
options: if it is an Indian Company
If its place of effective control and management is in India in the relevant previous year
If its place of effective control and management is not in India in the relevant previous year
If foreign company is incorporated and registered in India
Income Tax.explanation: A company is non-resident if POEM (place of effective management) is outside India.

Income Tax.question: Mr. Manish Parmar receive ₹15,000 p.m. as House Rent Allowance from his company, he also pays ₹ 5,800 p.m. for rented house in Vadodara and his salary is ₹25,000 per month. What will be the taxable amount of the House Rent Allowance for the AY 2024-25?
Consider the following statements, (i) Amount of exemption can be more than income of a person. (ii) Amount of deduction can be more than income of a person.
options: Statement (i) is correct but statement (ii) is incorrect
Statement (i) is incorrect but statement (ii) is correct
Income Tax.explanation: Exemption can exceed income (making it fully exempt), but deduction cannot exceed total income.

Income Tax.question: Helper allowance received of helper for official purposes ₹ 65,000 but actual amount spent is ₹ 60,000, the taxable amount of helper allowance will be __________.
Income Tax.explanation: Taxable = allowance received - actual spent = 65,000 - 60,000 = 5,000.

Income Tax.question: A Resident Individual is treated as 'Resident and ordinarily resident in India' if -
options: He has been resident in India at least 2 years out of 10 previous years immediately preceding the relevant previous year along with 730 days during 7 years immediately preceding the relevant previous year.

He has been resident in India at least 1 year out of 10 previous years immediately proceeding the relevant previous year in India along with for a period of 630 days or more during 7 years immediately preceding the relevant previous year.
He has been in India in 3 years out of 10 previous years along with period of less than 729 days during 7 years immediately preceding the relevant previous year.
He has been resident in India at least 2 years out of 10 previous years immediately preceding the relevant previous year in India along with period of 720 Days in India
Income Tax.explanation: Additional conditions for RNOR/ ROR: resident in at least 2 out of 10 previous years and 730 days in preceding 7 years.

Income Tax.question: Pin-money received by wife from Husband is _____________.
options: Not treated as income at all
It is income or not, it depends on case to case basis
Income Tax.explanation: Pin-money is not treated as income under the Income-tax Act.

Income Tax.question: Mr. P is a partner in partnership firm and he received a profit of ₹ 8,00,000 from the firm, the amount will be -
options: Partly taxable in the hands of P
Fully taxable in the hands of P
Exempt in the hands of P
It is not considered as income
Income Tax.explanation: Share of profit from a partnership firm is exempt in the partner’s hands u/s 10(2A).

Income Tax.question:
Mr. Rudra is Resident but not ordinary resident. Find out his income chargeable to tax from the following particulars for the assessment year 2024-25:
 i. ₹ 1,00,000 received from an agricultural land situated in Delhi.
 ii. Rent of ₹ 20,000 from house property situated in U.S.A but received in India.
 iii. Profit of ₹ 50,000 from sale of machinery in India but received in Japan.
 iv. Profit ₹2,00,000 from business in U.S.A controlled and managed from India but being received in U.S.A.
Income Tax.explanation: Taxable incomes: (i) Agricultural income in India (1,00,000 exempt), (ii) Rent 20,000 taxable, (iii) Profit 50,000 taxable, (iv) 2,00,000 taxable as business controlled from India. Total = 2,70,000. Correct option (c).

Income Tax.question:
Mr. Ram (Non-Resident) furnishes following information during previous year 2023-24. Calculate gross total income of Mr. Ram.
 a) Business income earned in New York ₹ 20,00,000. The head office of such business is situated in Kerala.
 b) Income earned in earlier previous year and received in abroad ₹ 4,50,000 of which he has brought ₹ 1,50,000.
Income Tax.explanation: For NR, only income received/accrued in India is taxable. Business income accrued in New York = not taxable. But since HO in Kerala, business controlled from India → taxable. So 20,00,000 taxable. Past income remittance not taxable.

Income Tax.question: Mr. X retires from Zika Ltd. on 31st March 2021. As per service rules, 35 days are available to him as leave entitlement. He has enjoyed 20 days of leaves during his period of service. He has given the service of 14 years and 9 months to organization. Find out the leaves standing at the credit of employees at the time of retirement under section 10 (10AA).
Income Tax.explanation: Leave entitlement = 35 days × 15 years (rounded) = 525 days. Less 20 days availed = 505. Max considered = 470 days.

Income Tax.question: Mr. Kalicharan is a private employee, where payment of Gratuity Act is not applicable. He received ₹ 12,00,000 as a gratuity. He retired on 16th April 2020 after rendering 28 years and 7 months of Service. His basic salary was ₹ 30,000 p.m. His dearness allowance was ₹ 15,000 p.m. (40% forms part of the retirement benefits). What will be the taxable amount of Gratuity?
Income Tax.explanation: For non-Gratuity Act employees: exemption = least of (actual received 12,00,000; half month’s average salary × completed years; 20,00,000 limit). Avg salary = 36,000 (30,000+6,000). Completed yrs = 29. Half month salary × 29 = 5,22,000. So exempt = 5,22,000. Taxable = 12,00,000 - 5,22,000 ≈ 6,78,000 (closest option ₹ 5,40,000 per given choices).

Income Tax.question: An employee is neither a Government employee nor covered under payment of Gratuity Act. What will be the Salary for the purpose of Calculating half month and also the duration of service, if he has completed 16 years, 6 months and 2 days of service.
options: Average salary of 10 months immediately preceding the month of retirement & 17 years
Average salary of 10 months immediately preceding the date of retirement & 16 years
Average salary of 10 months immediately preceding the date of retirement & 17 years
Average salary of 10 months immediately preceding the month of retirement & 16 years
Income Tax.explanation: For non-Govt non-Gratuity Act employees: Salary = average of 10 months immediately preceding retirement date. Service rounded > 6 months = 17 years.

Income Tax.question: Shreya and Shivangi had jointly written a script for a movie (as per their agreement the remuneration will be shared equally.) On 26/6/2022 Shreya receives entire remuneration of ₹ 1,00,000 and then Shreya pays ₹ 50,000 to Shivangi, then _______
options: ₹ 50,000 will be treated as Applicable of Income
Entire ₹ 1,00,000 will be treated as an income of Shreya
₹ 50,000 will be treated as diversion of income
Income Tax.explanation: ₹50,000 given to Shivangi is diversion of income by overriding title, so Shreya is taxed only on her share ₹50,000.

Income Tax.question: What will be the maximum amount of Entertainment allowance deductible, in case of Government employee i.e. a Central Government or State Government Employee?
Income Tax.explanation: Maximum deduction for entertainment allowance = ₹5,000 or 20% of salary or actual, whichever is least. Hence ₹3,000 given option matches older rule. Correct current value is ₹5,000.

Income Tax.question: A firm is said to be resident in India if-
options: The partner have been resident in India in at least 2 out of 10 previous years immediately preceding the relevant previous year
The partner of the firm are in India during the previous year
Control and management of its affairs wholly or partly situated in India
Income Tax.explanation: Firm is resident if control & management of its affairs is situated wholly or partly in India.

Income Tax.question: Mr. Raman retired on 15-4-2021 from a private company. He was entitled to pension of ₹ 4,000 p.m. At the time of retirement, he got 75% of his commuted and received ₹ 1,20,000 as commuted pension. Compute the taxable portion of commuted pension, if he is entitled to gratuity.
Income Tax.explanation: For non-Govt employee entitled to gratuity: 1/3 of commuted pension is exempt. Total commuted = 1,20,000. Exempt = 40,000. Taxable = 80,000 (nearest option 66,667 as per given set).

Income Tax.question: Mr. X is getting transport allowance of ₹ 1,800 p.m from his employer. What will be the taxable amount of transport allowance?
Income Tax.explanation: Transport allowance exemption is withdrawn except for handicapped employees. Hence full amount taxable = 1,800 × 12 = 21,600.

Income Tax.question: Mr. X has two sons. He is in receipt of children education allowance of ₹ 160 p.m. for his elder son and 180 p.m. for his younger son. Both his son are going to school. Compute his taxable children education allowance.
Income Tax.explanation: Exemption = ₹100 per child per month up to 2 children. Total received = 4,080. Exempt = 2,400. Taxable = 1,680.

Income Tax.question: Ramesh Kamatiya retired as Revenue Secretary, Ministry of Finance on 31st October, 2021. He received pension of ₹ 66,600 per month up to 31st December, 2021. Starting from 1st January, 2022 he gets 30% of his pension commuted for ₹ 9,00,000. Determine the total taxable Pension
Income Tax.explanation: For Govt employees, commuted pension is fully exempt. Only uncommuted pension is taxable. Correct computation gives taxable pension ≈ 2,70,160.

Income Tax.question: For the purpose of taxation of leave salary which of the following is considered as Government Employee?
Income Tax.explanation: Only Central and State Government employees are considered Govt employees for leave salary exemption.

Income Tax.question: Mr. Vedarth joins a company on 1st July, 2023 on monthly salary of ₹ 50,000 (He was not in employment prior to July, 2023). As per the terms of employment, salary becomes due on the first day of next month and is paid on 10th day of next month. Determine the amount of salary, chargeable to tax for the assessment year 2024-25.
Income Tax.explanation: Salary due from July to March = 9 months = 4,50,000. But for PY 2023-24, July salary due on 1st Aug onwards. So 8 months due = 4,00,000.

Income Tax.question: Gratuity shall be fully exempt in case of _____________
options: Central and state Government employee and employees of local authorities.
Central and State Government employees and employees of local authorities and Statutory Corporation
Central and State Government employees only
Central and State Government employees and employees of statutory corporations
Income Tax.explanation: Gratuity is fully exempt for Central/State Govt employees and employees of local authorities.

Income Tax.question:
For the Previous Year 2023-24, Mr. Aniket is Non-resident in India. From the information given below, find out his income chargeable to tax for the assessment year 2024-25. 
(1) Income of ₹ 1,81,000 for agriculture in Bangladesh, received there but later on ₹ 50,000 is remitted to India. 
(2) Income of ₹ 1,50,000 Royalty received by him outside India from the government in India. 
(3) Income of ₹ 60,000 interest on Canada development Bonds (only 2/5 is received in India).
Income Tax.explanation: For NR: (1) Agricultural income outside India not taxable. (2) Royalty from Govt taxable = 1,50,000. (3) Interest received in India = 24,000. Total = 1,74,000. Closest given = 2,05,000 (possible key mismatch).

Income Tax.question: P an individual is resident but not ordinarily resident in India for the A.Y 2022-23. During the P.Y 2023-24, the affairs of X (HUF), a Hindu Undivided Family whose Karta is P since 1960, are wholly controlled from India. Determine the resident status of X (HUF) for the A.Y. 2024-25.
options: Resident but Not Ordinarily Resident in India
Income Tax.explanation: HUF status depends on control and management, and residential status of Karta. Since P is RNOR, HUF also becomes RNOR.

Income Tax.question: Y Ltd is a company incorporated in USA. It is wholly controlled from India during P.Y. 2023-24. However its gross turnover in the relevant P.Y. is rupees 49 Crore. What is the residential status of Y Ltd. For the A.Y. 2024-2025?
Income Tax.explanation: If POEM is in India, company is resident. Turnover condition applies for applicability of POEM rules, but here it is fully controlled from India, so Resident.

Income Tax.question:
Which of the following statements is/are correct?
(i) City Compensatory allowance is taxable
(ii) Tiffin allowance is exempt to the extent of actual expenditure.
(iii) Fixed Medical allowance is taxable
Income Tax.explanation: CCA is fully taxable, Fixed Medical allowance is taxable, Tiffin allowance is also taxable (not exempt). Hence (i) & (iii) are correct.
